title: Europe Picks Up the Energy Weapon
sub_head: Proposed European Union embargo on Russian oil is a powerful sanction but won’t be painless, especially if Moscow retaliates
body:
Sequels are often bland imitations of the original, but the European Union’s sixth package of economic sanctions includes a dramatic new twist: a ban on Russian oil.
On Wednesday, the European Commission proposed a ban on EU purchases of Russian crude within six months and refined products by the end of the year. It isn’t the first to do it but the EU move is significant because the bloc buys almost half of Russian oil and oil-product exports. It is a weapon that President Vladimir Putin will notice.
